messages: 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:13): finds out that because of "The HTTP Origin header" draft CORS does not need to depend on HTML5 anymore
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:23): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: so we should take the Origin spec and CORS to PR together in WebApps
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:33): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: can WebApps take the Origin spec to PR if the IETF has the spec?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:34): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: IETF and HTTP WG in particular said they were not interested in publishing the spec
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:34): has trouble keeping up with Origin politics
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:59): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, Adam is still pushing it at IETF it seems
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:59): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, if they don't do it we should, yes, that makes sense
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:01): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: I can't imagine them changing their minds. the message was pretty much an unequivocal No the first time
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:02): remembers there's an IETF/W3C coordination call some time soon and figures he should probably add this to the agenda
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:02): I hope the IANA still agrees to register Origin
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:02): it's already registered for CORS, right?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:04): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, if that's the case maybe you should contact adam and ask him to reformat it so we can have FPWD?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:05): the concept it defines fits better at the W3C as well I think
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:05): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: yeah, I saw your e-mail comment about that
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:06): did proxy vendors ever comment on Origin?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:07): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: dunno if there's ever been a spec "foo Concept".. maybe Origin Mechanism?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:08): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: before Adam goes the trouble of reformatting, I will try to get some more info, by the end of next week, I think
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:08): I think the Strict Transport Security spec fits better at the W3C as well
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:10): most things fit better at the W3C if alone for their non-ancient publishing format (though if it's just about publishing format I guess WHATWG wins :p )
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:12): specs with scripts FTW!
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:21): W3C specs can have scripts. there's nothing in pubrules or anything else I've looked at that says they're prohibited
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:22): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I don't remember anybody in the previous discussion explicitly stating that they were are a proxy vendor
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:29): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: ok. is it just a matter of no one porting the crossref script to the W3C spec?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:30): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: not having explicit negative feedback from (people identifying selves as) proxy vendors is encouraging
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:30): about crossref script, yeah, pretty much
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:31): I'm already using it on my markup draft though
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:31): the single-page version of that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:31): http://dev.w3.org/html5/markup/spec.html
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:32): e.g., if you to to http://dev.w3.org/html5/markup/spec.html#common.data.uri-mdl and click on the "uri" in orangered
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:32): I wonder why that script does not work in Opera
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:33): is due to lose battery power in 8 minutes
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:33): oh, now it does
a51b9c3c0f2ada2a6d118030324def95 (14:34): Was <dialog> taken out of the specification?
a51b9c3c0f2ada2a6d118030324def95 (14:34): I've been searching the archives, but what was the reasoning behind that?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:34): I plan to add a generated index from <dfn>s as an alternative to the xref script, for the multipage version
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:35): a51b9c3c0f2ada2a6d118030324def95, didn't address the use cases well enough and was only for a relatively minor use cases
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:57): hmm, referencing httpbis is a pain
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:57): http is now all over the place :/
